name: Bucetalon
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4496
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base, with a melting point around 106°C, due to the presence of two carbonyl groups and the rigidity they bring. The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, which can contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +5°C. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +5°C. The presence of two additional phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Phenyl groups, when connected to a benzene ring, can add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure.
